intro: Wahlenbergia acaulis, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has a compact, low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Wahlenbergia acaulis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
